intro: Dolichoura spiritusanctensis, commonly known as the sacred spirit vine, is a climbing plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its long, trailing stems and clusters of small, waxy flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains various alkaloids, some of which have been studied for their pharmacological properties. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers are typically white or pale pink. Due to its unique chemical composition, it has attracted interest in both botanical research and traditional medicine.
